Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: Robb301
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to all the great sights. One block to subway station on main artery. LOTS of shopping and restaurants within a few blocks. Very accomodating staff and great breakfast! Rooms are very clean and very well appointed/comfortable/modern. Usual 'small' European style rooms, but NICEST I've stayed at in this price range and higher. Definately will be staying there when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: 2xelmundo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights and the location is the best! It is in a small street, very quiet but close to everywhere. The hotel is small and they do not offer lots of services, but everything is well solved. They offer complimentary new release films in the room, minibar included (non alcoholic drinks), and the rooms are not big but for Paris good enough size. The amenities they have in the rooms are great as well. One of the receptionist was not nice, but during checked out I was told he was replacing someone and was not a permanent staff. I recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: jcr98
Reviews.Content: This is a beautique hotel located in the Marais district, only a block away from a Metro stop and very near the major tourist center of Paris. The room is an excellent value, and it is very clean and modern. The staff was very friendly and the service was wonderful. The best part about this location is that it is just far enough away from the madness of the major tourist areas, but also has lots of trendy shops, and great places to eat very nearby with English menus and friendly waitstaff. The neighborhood is very clean and quaint, and not jam packed crowded. The Metro line will take you right to Notre Dame and the L'Ouvre and other major sites without a transfer, or it is walkable.

Reviews.Title: “A Paris gem in St Paul Marais”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: Discovered on the internet, a real gem. Really friendly staff, small hotel yet large rooms, great bathroom, L'Occitane toiletries, free in room movies, internet and non alcoholic minibar. Great location, quiet but close to everything. We would definitely stay there again on next visit to Paris. Breakfast room downstairs is tiny and a bit claustrophobic but the rest of the hotel more than compensates.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Treat From Start to Finish”
Reviews.Author: OffWeGoSydney
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this little gem of a hotel, highly enough! From first walking through the front doors and being greeted by the absolutely delightful Sandra, to the gorgeous rooms to the amazing location, it was perfect. Little touches like free minibar, L'Occitane toiletries, free movies and lovely decor made the whole experience of this hotel fantastic. Some people have commented that the rooms are small, but I didnt find this so. There was more than enough room for our luggage and all the shopping we accumulated over our stay. I will absolutely stay at this hotel on my (hopefully soon) return to Paris. Five stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: kikico
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris many times, and have always found it difficult to find a hotel that is reasonably priced, well-located, chic, and with rooms that aren't the size of a closet. Finally!--the Hotel Caron ticks all of these boxes, and then some. Situated on a quiet and quaint street, near the sites and amenities of the Marais and convenient to the Metro, it is a lovely typically Parisian hotel building. The staff (namely the gentleman who mans the desk) was extremely helpful and friendly, and spoke perfect English (after politely putting up with my broken French). The hotel is small to be sure, but very clean and the decor was more pleasing than I had anticipated in the pictures--the green wasn't a great choice, but it was better in person. My room (room 2, I believe) was large by Paris standards, with a lovely wall of windows, room to move around without hitting into my 6 foot 4 inch boyfriend, and with a nice sized bathroom with bathtub and nice l'Occitane toiletries. We did not eat breakfast there, however the stone vaulted breakfast room was lovely. They also had a complimentary mini-bar (an unexpected little bonus), umbrellas to use, and all the nice little perks that are sometimes cut from a mid-range hotel. Finally, the bed was amazingly comfortable and the room quiet. I couldn't recommend it more.

Reviews.Title: “January Break”
Reviews.Author: fffiona
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Carron was a perfect location for our short break. It is really well situated for underground and bus routes to all the main sites and the local area is lovely. The hotel is lovely. Small rooms as you should expect in Paris, however the free mini-bar, free internet access and free in room movies were all nice touches. The staff are very friendly and helpful too. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Londonspx
Reviews.Content: First time to Paris, booked last minute and was pleasantly suprised by everything about Hotel Caron. Location is great! It is a on a quiet side street close to a pretty square just of of Rue de Rivoli and within minutes of Place des Vosges. The metro is close by as well as a taxi rank but if you are happy to walk everything is accessible, the main sights (Notre Dame, Louvre, the Iles and of course the river and a wonderful selection of shops. The welcome was very friendly. Our room was small as all rooms are in France but it was really nicely decorated, clean and well serviced by the maid each day. As part of the room rate you get free movies and there is a good selection. We were out of our room all day but they were great to wind down to. There is also a small mini bar selection of non alcoholic drinks that is within the rate that they replenish what you use daily which again is handy. There is a safe. Room temperatrure and noise were fine and the bed was comfortable as were the pillows and we both slept well every night. In fact our room was right next to the lift, the floor outside carpeted and we wondered if this would bother us but we did not hear a sound and the hotel was full. There are 6 floors and 3 rooms to a floor I think. The little breakfast room is very cute and the food on offer was very good though we only used it on the first day preferring to go out on other mornings as we wanted to experience Paris with the Parisiens. You can get breakfast in your room. There is also a room service menu with a good selection though a cold selection and a little bit pricey. We were really pleased with the hotel and would recommend to friends and return ourselves in the future. Regarding Paris if you are romantic get yourself a padlock before you go so you can add it to the bridge by Notre Dame with the name of you and you partner on it. Picture attached - it is very romantic!

Reviews.Title: “incredible location!”
Reviews.Author: adaryud
Reviews.Content: Hotel Caron is a small hotel, located in the heart of the marais, surrounded with beautiful small parisian streets, small cafe's and restaurants, and good smell of boulangeries. Although the rooms are 'petit', it`s a very friendly hotel, with smiling staff. The minibar is free(!!!) and refilled every day(!!!). You can have breakfast at the hotel for extra cash, but it`s better to have it on a nearest cafe' (Miss Manon is just across the street and very recommended). During 2010 they have redecorated the hotel, so the rooms are very nice and feel like new. If you consider the location, the prices are OK. Between us, you only need a bed in Paris, cause in this city you just can`t stay in the room...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jld94114
Reviews.Content: Greeted by Sandra who was absolutely charming and always smiling. Excellent location in the heart of Le Marais. Room was small, but nicely appointed... free wireless was a nice touch. Sandra at the front desk was a great help in making restaurant reservations and recommendations. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: gazzerukukuk
Reviews.Content: The hotels location is fantastic, just off Rue de Rivoli and in Le Marais district, two minutes walk from Saint Paul metro station. The rooms were small but who on earth wants to stay in the room when you have the whole of Paris to explore. The night time front desk man was extremely friendly and smiley but we found the daytime desk man rather grumpy. Still, this is a very nice hotel, very clean and even had a free fridge full of soft drinks! I would stay here again when visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Troupy_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very handily located just off the Rue St Antoine in a bustling area and close to a lovely, romantic square full of bars. It's very close to Saint-Paul metro station. The room we stayed in was small but perfectly adequate for a weekend stay when you don't intend to spend long in it anyway. The staff - particularly Hassan on the front desk - were very friendly indeed and let us leave our baggage in a locked side room hours before we were able to check in. The room rate includes the contents of the mini bar (nothing alcohol, alas) and movies, but again, if you're having the kind of fantastic weekend we had you're not going to be interested in either! This hotel is perfect for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Paris for 2 night, in Le Marais”
Reviews.Author: nykwilkyins
Reviews.Content: stayed by mistake, thought we were going to the Caron de Beaumashais, which is 3 streets away. Will check more carefully next time, but no problems. Charming front of house, very good breakfast, which seemed expensive at 18 euros each, but would have cost more in a cafe --assuming you want a hearty breakfast and not just a coffe and croissant. newly decorated with Porcelanosa bathroom, free wifi and internet, air con. V comfortable bed, but the room itself was compact, but fine for 8 hours of sleep. great location, for sights, shopping and and restaurants, recommend Monjul and des Gars dans la cuisine. travel tip...we flew to Orly with BA, sale price as SLF airlines (self loading freight), but with no baggage restrictions. and orly was 25 minute cab ride for 30 Euros, compared to 2 airport bus rides to Invalides, which is not exaxtly convenient willl

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: DrDH11
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Hotel Caron in the Marais area. This is a small boutique hotel and for its class is fine. It is conveniently located near the St. Paul metro and walking distance to Notre Dame, Louvre, and there are many excellent restaurants and quality shopping within a few blocks. The reception personnel were friendly and accommodating. The room was very clean and the mini bar stocked with water, soft drinks, and snacks for no charge. I would definitely return. This is a great area of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: 3Slaters
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night, before a tour and was pleasantly surprised. The room, although small, was extremely comfortable and in a fantastic location. The staff were friendly, allowed us to check in very early, we didn't even have to ask, and the room price includes a well stocked mini bar of water, soft drinks and snacks. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: eatandrun33
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with this hotel. It’s in a fantastic location (near place des vosages) a short walk from trendy shopping areas and an abundance of restaurants and the metro. The rooms, although slightly compact are clean, modern and lovely. The bathroom was also modern and spotless with small hairdryer and L’occitane products. There is no full length mirror in the rooms. The beds and pillows are extremely comfortable and the linen white and clean. Internet access was free, as was an extensive selection of movies on demand. The free minibar offered 2 x sparkling mineral water, coke, iced tea, juice, kit-kat, chips, nuts and a few other things. There was a bar directly opposite, but with the windows closed and the air-conditioning on, we couldn’t hear a thing. We would definitely recommend this hotel for a short stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Turned out to be a great hotel--but they need to be more honest in the photos they post”
Reviews.Author: Seth L
Reviews.Content: Great hotel--clean, well appointed, friendly and helpful staff, and reasonably priced for the area. Cons: 1) Across street from disgusting Scottish pub that is filled with loud drunks that scream all night; 2) a tad pricey; 3) minimal space to store luggage if you need to check out and then roam around before a flight. Also, they have a few pics on thier site that seem to indicate that they have some large courtyard setup or something. THIS IS A SMALL, city hotel that is in a small apartment-style buidling. Would have given this 4 stars if not for this little LIE!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Paris”
Reviews.Author: nobeansprouts
Reviews.Content: Firstly this isn't the cheapest hotel yet, however they do live up to the price you pay. I know of plenty that don't! Yes it is small, but that did not ever seem to be an issue. We reckon that this was the best hotel in our tour of Europe, it just worked. The beds were good, love the hot shower, clean rooms and bathroom, nice free toiletries, free wifi and FREE MINIBAR for your FREE MOVIES! We had a great time watching movies and catching up on the must needed rest after walking through Paris. It is in a great location with Saint Paul metro just a stones throw away, there is a supermarket and heaps of nice restaurants scattered all over the location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Extraordinary Location”
Reviews.Author: galutengirl
Reviews.Content: First of all...can't wait to return to this lovely hotel. Actually - almost hate to leave a review because I would be SOOOO disappointed if I could not get a booking in what is sure to be a VERY popular hotel. Want to leave a big happy thank you to Theirry the lovely man at reception. He is really, really nice and helpful. I was there with a friend and can't wait to return with my husband. I also (if we can afford it) would return with an adjoining room with my 8 year old son as well. The location can't be beat. The free wifi, minibar and movies BIG bonus! I love Paris and I love this hotel. Yes the rooms are small but, hey, this is Paris. Get over it. Meanwhile... it is pristine with a great location. Felt safe, loved and happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location. Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Vitsk
Reviews.Content: Location absolutely fantastic for cafes, bistros, bars, shopping, metro... you name it. Loved the hotel. Contemporary decor with classic touches, exceptionally clean and the bed was very comfortable. Loccitane bathroom products was a treat, and FREE minibar (non-alcoholic) - who doesn't love that?!! Additionally, for the travellers who can't sleep, free movies on demand in most languages. The only minor negative (and it is minor) was that our room was on the top floor, attic style, and it was small. Although this is typical of mid range Paris accommodation; and honestly, you should out and about anyway! Staff were AMAZING! We have previously had a not-so-great experience in Paris and were wary of asking for help. However we were so pleasantly surprised when the staff demonstrated a genuine interest in us, our expectations and were always happy to help. We will definitely stay at Hotel Caron again, and will recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for a perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: CAH2010
Reviews.Content: There are SO many options when booking a hotel in Paris. My first requirement was the location, La Marais is absolutely the best place to stay in Paris, especially if you are there on the weekend and Hotel Caron is right by all of the boutiques, cafes and also a main Metro station and a nice walking distance to the river. Its found on a little street off the main road which is perfect for a some peace in the heart of a busy city. The lobby is trendy, spotless and very modern as is all of the communal areas. The staff were very helpful, printing off maps of everywhere we wanted to get to. Our room (52) was very clean, comfortable and chic. The only downside is the size, but i expected this from Paris, until i went next door into our friends room and it was dramatically bigger! (room 51). The bathroom was spotless and had fab amenities, the shower was also really good! All in all we couldnt have asked for a better gem in paris, the location, staff and room were all perfect for us. We will absolutely stay there the next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTravellers008
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Caron 18th August for 3 nights, we were surprised by the quality of the Hotel, understand it has only been open for a little over 12 months. While our room was of a modest size it was extremely comfortable, very clean and we enjoyed the near new bathroom. Great to have a lift, we were on the 5th floor!! The staff could not have been more helpfull and professional. The Hotel is located within meters of a very delightfull square with at least 5 restaurants, bars, with more restaurants on the fringe of the square, no need to move to far for dinner. It is also easy walking distance to Notre Dame, Hotel de Ville and the river BataBuses, very convenient to everything. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Caron, we would happily recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My second stay at this great Hotel' loved it as much as the 1st stay.”
Reviews.Author: chrissygLasVegas
Reviews.Content: I had a bit more time to explore Paris this trip, and really got a great feel for the location of Hotel Caron. You are in the heart of great restaurants, shopping and antique exploring. Across the street is a British Pub, and a courtyard of restaurants. The Korean bbq is awesome. The luxury beds and plasma tvs make it feel like a W brand hotel , free cable internet and best of all free minibar treats. If youve been to Paris you know that you normally paid for this. But not here-- we will return to this Hotel every time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in 4eme”
Reviews.Author: Vivien L
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this lovely hotel. While the rooms are not what you'd call spacious (it is Paris), the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was modern and the L'Occitane products were a nice touch. There was free WiFi and the TV doubled up as a computer screen, and you were able to access the internet with a small wireless keyboard on your TV. While there have been some comments about the reception staff being a little frosty, I found them to be extremely friendly and helpful. I think it helps when you attempt to speak French (wherever you go in Paris). The French seem to welcome the fact that you make the effort, and really warm up to you. They were very patient with my basic French, especially the lady, who even helped me with directions to the local bookstore to purchase a book on French grammar. I think that made her smile :) 'coz she knew I needed that. Location was excellent - close to the shopping streets of Le Marais, a stone's throw to St. Paul metro station (on Line 1 - which is the main metro line to most of the tourist attractions), two great boulangeries across the road on rue de Rivoli for your breakfast croissants, a convenience store within walking distance, lots of restaurants around the area. Everything you could ask for in a hotel in Paris, really!!

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: LMCOX
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to Hotel Caron returning from business elsewhere in France and prior to returning to the US from Paris. The hotel is elegant, quiet and efficient. The neighborhood (Le Marais) is always exciting. Proximity to metro, shopping, dining and sites is terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Back again and just as happy.”
Reviews.Author: bobk56
Reviews.Content: Second year in a row I made a trip to Paris and stayed at Hotel Caron. Happy to say, nothing has changed. Still an excellant hotel. Receptionist extremely helpful and polite. Rooms immaculate and well decorated. Mini bar well stocked and free. Internet free. Widest selection of movies of any hotel I have stayed at. And free. Great hot shower. And, of course, location can not be beat. Looking forward to going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “What a special place within Paris”
Reviews.Author: foodbevconsultant
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked into this LOVELY litle hotel for our stay in Paris. We were greeted by a delightful concierge whose English was impeccable. The lobby was inviting. Local snacks (Madeleines) were offered and were a pleasant surprise. We took the elevator to our room which was PERFECT. Well decorated. Modern decor. Great desk from which i could work. Windows to allow in fresh air but when closed they prevented from the noise of the city to wake us. Comfortable beds. All items in mini bar? Complimentary. Terrific bath and water pressure. Charming breakfast room. Very special space with a pleasant attendant. A wonderful place to stay in the city center! Signed a meeting planner for executives who books travel and hotel stays for clients all over the world. Really impressive place.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly, very small and expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Benny_Hill_USA
Reviews.Content: We were able to spend about a week in Florence and Rome and then spend 24 hours in Paris on our way back home to the U.S. The Italians were absolutely wonderful but the French... well, they did a great job of matching their stereotype. Unfriendly, not helpful and generally standoffish. The woman at the front desk was borderline rude the two or three times we had to interact with her. Our room was the most expensive place we stayed during our honeymoon and it was by far the smallest. The bathroom was the smallest bathroom I've ever been in - the shower was about the size of an upright coffin. The bed was very comfortable and there was a handy (though small) desk in the room. The hotel looked very nice and it's in a great location. Close to the Champs-Élysées, the Louvre, the Orsay, etc. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: n6travellerLondon
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in the Marais and the location of the hotel couldn't have been better. The rooms were compact but smart and nicely decorated and furnished. The free minibar is a nice touch. I would definitely return and recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but super small room”
Reviews.Author: Alexandre92100
Reviews.Content: Was there again for 1 night. Had the room n°52 if I remember well. Like I said in my previous review, the location is excellent, the hotel is modern and the staff friendly. But, really, the room was terribly small. Nearly no space at all to empty your luggage. As I was there for 1 night only, it was ok but if you would stay 5/6 days, there's nowhere you could unpack. The bathroom was also tiny. I've been to many hotels in Paris and, for this price, you can really get a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in a great location if a little expensiove”
Reviews.Author: OttawaResortlover
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Caron for a 4 night stay in Paris on recommendation of friends. It is ideally situated in a lively part of the city (the Marais), close to the river and a handy metro (St Paul)metro but just away from the main tourist drags. The room was clean and modern, and air- conditioned. Free internet (wifi and via TV). Free water and soft drinks in the minibar is a nice touch too. With only 18 rooms the hotel is quiet and the staff are friendly. Breakfast is OK but in a small cellar and rather expensive. We would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “A great boutique hotel in le Marais”
Reviews.Author: Miamatt
Reviews.Content: This is a really smart hotel within very close distance of central Le Marais. All 4 of us enjoyed our stay here and look forward to returning. Rooms are small but modern and very well presented. The front desk did everything asked of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly & helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: NJbeachgirl09
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in the Marais district. The Hotel Caron is in a great location. Many cafes, restaurants and historic sights are nearby as is a metro stop. The hotel is beautifully renovated and up to date. Very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank317
Reviews.Content: Hotel Caron is a wonderful small hotel ideally located near Saint Paul metro in the Marais! The rooms are small but new, clean and modern with sleek bathrooms. Storage is a tiny problem. The rooms come with free Internet including WiFi, free on demand movies and large flat screen TVs. The staff could not be more helpful or friendly including setting up transfers from the airport and suggesting restaurants at which they gladly made reservations. Breakfast was great but a little expensive for what it included. This was my second stay at the Hotel Caron and I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, would return”
Reviews.Author: Captpablo
Reviews.Content: I really have always enjoyed the Marias and have been looking for a hotel in this area for a while. Hotels in Paris are small and expensive overall. We tend to find places that allow us to not be a tourist and do more local things versus stay near the major tourist attractions. I felt this hotel was reasonably priced and a good value overall. Pros: Easy access to Airports. Taxi stand is right up the street and easy to get a taxi at anytime. Save $ and don't book ahead with the front desk. They charge for the pickup. Lots of cafe's and grocery stores close by. The Marias is a short walk. Free wifi and mini bar. comfortable bed. Great restaurants and shopping. Cons: Yes, that lady at the front is not very nice. We did get her to lighten up and even laugh. She was fine after that. Our room was really small, even for Paris. If you have more that two suitcases, forget it. When we return to Paris this will be our hotel. Can't beat the location or price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, great location but rude, unfriendly staff - AVOID”
Reviews.Author: RichardWEason
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are small but stylish and very well maintained, I found the receptionist incredibly rude. When I arrive around 7pm on a freezing cold evening, the reception was unstaffed and the front door locked. I tried the door a number of times and, after about 5 minutes, noticed a small buzzer at the side which I rang. 3 or so minutes later the receptionist appeared and offered a grudging welcome. When I pointed out that I'd been outside for approaching 10 minutes waiting, she said that this 'wasn't possible' as she'd only left the reception for a few minutes and anyway, 'I should have rung the bell if I needed to get in'. Charming. Once unpacked I needed to borrow an iron and ironing board and, as the reception was again unstaffed, I had no choice but to go outside and ring the door bell again to attract her attention. For 200 Euros a night I expect better service than this. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in Marais”
Reviews.Author: Saturday
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in several hotels in various arrondisements over the years, Hotel Caron is the nicest at which I've stayed in this price range. I won't repeat what others have said in detail, but location is very good, street is quiet, convenient to everything. Small size of room is normal for Paris at this price, so the modern decor, amenities & well-thought out design details were key. I think I'd max out at four nights, but for a longer stay I'd rent an apartment anyway. A note about the staff. There is one woman (forgot her name) during the day who is very brisk. VERY brisk, curt even, which I don't appreciate, but I chose to give her the benefit of the doubt and took her demeanor to be that of a strict, no-nonsense mother figure. All other staff were very pleasant and friendly. I think I've finally found my go-to for short visits in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel, however, front desk unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: ctmcm
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small, neat, clean and would have given this place a 3-4 star rating, however, I found all women at the front desk extremely unfriendly and not helpful.This was not my experience with other establishments in Paris during my stay. Next time will definitely find another hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: enfuego06
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Caron. The location is fantastic, the hotel is located on a side street, just off the Rue Rivoli; so it is quiet yet just steps from restaurants, banks, supermarket, and the St. Paul metro station. St. Paul is on a very convenient line that gets you to all of the main tourist attractions and just one transfer gets you to Montmarte. The hotel is also walking distance to the Seine, Notre Dame, Place des Vosges. The room was modern, clean and comfortable. The complimentary wifi and soda/water/snacks are a great perk. Everyone at the front desk was friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff Should be classified as 5 star. Definately recommend this place”
Reviews.Author: PeterGiorgis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Caron, and found that the staff were absolutely amazing. BA had lost my luggage which took 4 days to arrive, and the staff were on the phone constantly to the airline to find it. The rooms are of 5 star quality and really well done, and the beds are the comfiest i have experienced in Paris. The other fantastic thing about this hotel is that the minibar, movies and WiFi are complimentary. This is a first as i travel all over the world for work and this was a pleasant supprise. I wish i had booked more nights at this hotel, as i ended up changing hotels to as friends were staying in St Germaine. I wish i hadn't pre booked the other hotel, as this one was 5 star, and was not as good as Hotel Caron. I will definately get in early when next in Paris and the location is awesome. 5 minute walk to either St Pual or Bastille Metro stop. Really handy location and lots of great places to go from Dinner and Breakfast. I will definately book this and have recommended it to friends. Thankyou to the staff who went above and beyond. I did get my luggage in the end. Only to loose it again on the way back to Australia. Got to love Heathrow

Reviews.Title: “Well decorated but expensive boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AndyJB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully decorated in a very contemporary style. But the room (37) was small (but perhaps not abnormally so for central Paris 3* hotels). The service was adequate. Very convenient for Le Marais area in Paris which is definitely one of the areas to stay in Paris. Lots of bars and restaurants in the area. You certainly pay for the decoration: this was expensive even compared to other similar hotels in central Paris. They provided a cot for our daughter, complete with soft toy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location-too noisy, not friendly”
Reviews.Author: landre40
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a great location. However, there is a lot of noise from the street and the hotel staff is not very friendly or helpful. The rooms are tiny. If you have more than one bag it is impossible to get around the room comfortably. There is no room to put your baggage anywhere! Overall, the rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. The bathrooms are also tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Great Location - Too Small”
Reviews.Author: Nate000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Caron for 4 nights. Fantastic location - the Marais district is stunning and very close to everything. Gorgeous restaurants and beautiful little streets. The hotel is a small, boutique hotel which if staying on my own, would have been fine however for 2 people; our room was way too small. We could barely walk between the end of the bed and the wall. The service was OK however Isabelle on reception is very rude! She barely cracks a smile and made us feel uncomfortable if we needed to ask about anything. This is a shame as all the other hotel staff were really lovely, particularly Sandra. Isabelle was on reception when we checked in approx 7pm after a bit of a harrowing trip from London to Paris. All we wanted was to check in, shower and head to dinner but she made the whole process more awkward than it needed to be...advising that even though I had changed our booking from 7 nights to 4 nights several weeks before our stay and had been advised on several occasions by the hotel that there was no charge for the change - she still felt it necessary to inform me, three times, that the hotel should have charged me - which actually they shouldn’t have given the weeks in advance I changed the original booking, plus the written confirmations I had from the hotel advising there was no charge for the change. Not a huge thing but when you're tired, in a new city and just want a shower, this is not want you want to be greeted with. So - having raved on about all that - we still enjoyed our stay, will just go with something bigger (still in the Marais district) next time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in the lively Le...”
Reviews.Author: Snozz81
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel in the lively Le Marais area. Good size rooms with complimentary in-house movies, wifi and minibar. Friendly helpful staff and a good breakfast. No restaurant on site but many options within sight from your own room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Caron offers special amenities to the traveler”
Reviews.Author: crh1013
Reviews.Content: Hotel Caron offers special amenities to the traveler. This is true whether they be in Paris for business or pleasure. In my recent case it was both and I truly enjoyed the Hotel in both areas. Hotel Caron is a Boutique Hotel (18 rooms). It is located in the heart of Paris and is close to just about everything. Out the door and turn left, walk 100 yards and one finds themselves in an area of small parks, narrow streets, open air restaurants and Paris life as one might expect watching old American movies. Sight and sounds with music in the park (Saturday evening) gives the visitor the feeling he has stepped out on one of those old movies sets. Turn right and walk 50 yards to a main Paris street (Rue St. Antoine) and there is immediate access to modern day shops, including ATMs, and the Metro (1 1/2 blocks). From the Metro it easy to access major tourist sites for example, Notre Dame, Louvre, Museum D'Orsay, and Eiffel Tower (all which we visited) etc. The Hotel has recently been nicely renovated. Bath rooms have all new fixtures, rooms with decent mattress and furnishings and all have a new TV on each wall. While CNN was the only English language station available, the Hotel does offer free movies to the occupant in English. Couple this with the free mini bar, (soft drinks, water, peanuts, chips, candy) and I found it a nice complement for the guest. I left wondering when the last time I was offered free access to movie and snack at any hotel. The free wifi also allowed us communication back to the US while we were in country. Since most US Cell phone carriers do not operate outside the US or charge dearly for the ability, I found this a very worthwhile and welcome benefit from the Hotel. The staff was magnificent. Every request was promptly attended. Sandra is a special person who made us feel so comfortable while we were guests at the hotel. In the past when we visited Paris, I use to shop for hotels. No more, I have found the place I like to stay. My wife and I look forward to the next Paris visit and returning to Hotel Caron.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel, great service, fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: mab1948
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel in Marais is a real hidden jewel. The rooms are clean and modern, free in room wi-fi and movies. And the location can't be beat, with shopping, galleries and restaurants and night life close by. The staff is very helpful and accommodating. And the room rates are very reasonable, particularly for what you get. This is my new go-to place in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden jewel in the heart of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: bobk56
Reviews.Content: If you want all the amenities: charm, service, location, cleanliness, quiet, without all the fuss, then this hotel is for you. Immaculate, air conditioned rooms with a good hot shower, First hotel I have stayed in in 20 years where I was not nickeled and dimed for everything. Free minibar, free in-room movies, free internet access. Surrounded by restaurants and cafes. If you want to walk Paris, you are only two blocks from the Seine and a short walk to all the famous attractions of Paris. If you want to use the metro, there is station one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in heart of the Marais”
Reviews.Author: PeterH099
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a design boutique hotel in the heart of Paris, and found all of it in Hotel Caron. Of course, it is Paris, so rooms are small and the city sounds are there on the background. But the lay-out of the room is efficient and the quality of the finishing (including the bed and bathroom) is above Paris levels. Location is ideal, at 200m of the St Paul Metro station (line 1) and with the restaurants and shops of the Marais around the corner. Good base to discover the beauty of this town.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: BrainSnag
Reviews.Content: Really great location next to a small square with several great restaurants within minutes. Yes, the rooms are small, but the amenities, location and friendliness of the staff made up for it easily. We definitely knew we were spoiled when our next stop in Rome was by really poor in comparison. If I return to Paris I would choose the Hotel Caron once again. A bonus is that the St. Paul Metro was a block away, a self serve laundry is around the corner, a bus tour stop and a pharmacy are also only a 1/2 block away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of the historic Marais”
Reviews.Author: UrbanTravelerToronto
Reviews.Content: A small, recently renovated, beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of the historic Marais district, perfect for a romantic vacation. Small rooms tastefully decorated in black, metallic gray, and white, with WiFi and mini-bar free of charge. Within easy walking distance of the Place des Vosges, Musee Carnavalet, Musee Picasso, many seventeenth-century "hotels particuliers," as well as the gay and Jewish areas. Very friendly staff, particularly Sandra, who made lunch and dinner reservations for many excellent neo-bistros throughout the city. Ideal choice for the "bohemian-bourgeois" crowd. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A good find in the heart of Le Marais”
Reviews.Author: mec_uk
Reviews.Content: Firstly, remember this hotel is in Paris! Parisiens are generally not the warmest people! Having said that, the receptionist was friendly and helpful, if a little curt at times. The room was small, but again this is Paris. However the room was very niceley docarated and immaculate. The location of this hotel is perfect situated in the marais area and very close to the metro. We had a really enjoyable stay there, having said that we had one bad experience with the night porter, who was incredibly rude to us and ignored us when we needed some help booking a restaurant on my birthday. In the end we just had to leave as he was making continuous phonecalls to avoid talking to us and find a restaurant on our own. Having said that, the hotel was good and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexandre92100
Reviews.Content: Very good surprise, nice hotel, very cosy and extremely well located and quiet. The staff was very nice too. Stayed 1 night in the room #51. Comfortable and modern. Free internet connection and a good bathroom. The only point is that the closet is pretty small so perfect for a few days with light luggage. I would certainemy recommend it

Reviews.Title: “SECOND STAY AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: francophile32
Reviews.Content: ....and it did not disappoint. All aspects fine - even when we were woken by the fire alarm at 8.30am - not bad really! - we were offred a free breakfast. Sandra, as always , was FABULOUS. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “cramped and rather smelly”
Reviews.Author: czetkin
Reviews.Content: Good location, but truly minute rooms, drain smells in the air and a false fire alarm got us all up at 6.00 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “small hotel, big on quality and personal service”
Reviews.Author: guychristiandare
Reviews.Content: everything about this Hotel speaks quality; room finishes to a very high standard, including superb shower facility with L'Occitane toiletries to pamper. Reception was also very helpful with great local restaurant advice, that reinforced the overriding atmosphere of laid back, non-intrusive service. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique hotel in Marais”
Reviews.Author: NY_SeasonedTraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel Caron is a great hotel in Marais, close to trendy stores and restaurants. The rooms are small yet modern and warm. My one complaint is that the water did not get very hot in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in marvelous Le Marais”
Reviews.Author: LMCOX
Reviews.Content: This is a modern and charming small hotel just a stone's throw away from Rue de Rivoli and the fun restaurants and great shopping of The Marais district of Paris. A wonderful comfy bed and nicely designed bathroom (with stand up enclosed shower) was a welcome haven for this business traveler. The staff was courteous and all spoke English (and understood my challenged French). The continental breakfast was offered in a bright cozy alcove one floor below the lobby. The elevator is large enough for more than one person with luggage. Internet connection was a little spotty during my stay - had to go back and forth from wifi to cable connection. Ask for the wifi access codes at the front desk when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “"American in Paris" in 2010”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttravel_10
Reviews.Content: As a business person who travels frequently and generally stays in 5 star hotels, it was a particular treat for me to stay in Hotel Caron. First it offers a quaint setting that one would expect of a small boutique hotel. I was very impressed with the staff and their willingness to attend to any and every detail, and they were exceptionally friendly. The hotel is newly renovated and is very clean and attractive. I was impressed with the rooms and with the free mini bar, the free internet access and the free wi fi. The free Video On Demand was a big plus to me with lots of movies. Couple the exceptional setting of this 18 room hotel with its prime location in Paris; e.g. 25 minutes to the Champs Elysee, less than two minutes walk to the Metro and the fact that in the immediate area are great shops, Bars,Cafes, and Restaurants gives me the feeling that I have found a rather unique place to unwind in a great city in a very busy world. I am booking my return to Hotel Caron for August 2010

Reviews.Title: “Have Stayed Everywhere In PARIS and The Caron was hard to beat!”
Reviews.Author: Blueskyes
Reviews.Content: First off, to compare the Hotel Caron to the Maurice or Le Bristol or the Ritz would be silly -but I will... I have stayed at all the before mentioned hotels on many, many occasions. My wife and I are well traveled and from the Burj al Arab, to the Dorchester we've stayed at them all... and not in the standard rooms and not for just a night or two. - And your first question would be the most obvious ok, So why??? Why in the world did you pick The Hotel Caron, if 5 star hotels with the utmost attention to detail and service tend to be your prerequisite? Short answer: We wanted to try something different. -And different it was in so many wonderful ways. Your right -No Doorman, No Bellhops, No Elevator Attendant, No world Class restaurant, No Bar, No Concierge, No Butler... OMG how were we going to survive... We had a blast! Fist of all it's like Brand new, modern and in many ways ergonomically correct for its size and stature. The location in the 4th was perfect, and let’s face it, if the 4th is where you like to stroll during your stays in Paris (which we do) then boutique hotels are what you get. The room was delightfully small, intimate and yes we made all 6 of our Tumi travel bags fit without tripping over them. The linens and towels were soft and fresh, the amenities in the bath were delightful and plentiful even if they weren't Hermes, and at night it was fun to just darken the room and turn it into a screening room theater in bed. The size of the Television in this smaller room made it feel like a Cinema Screen. I felt like a kid, it was really a fun stay! And everyone we spoke to at the hotel and yes there seemed to be someone different every time we walked in was fabulous, really sweet and thoughtful. -And I have to be honest with you, and let you know that we are truly fortunate and can afford to stay anywhere we like and I assure you we'll be back to the Caron for sure next Fall.

Reviews.Title: “DISFUNCTIONAL WITH POOR SERVICE/SPEND YOUR MONEY ELSEWHERE”
Reviews.Author: JeffGold
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Paris and won’t be staying at the Hotel Caron again—primarily because of the very rude manager, Isabelle. This is a small hotel and there is never more than one person working in the small lobby—and unfortunately in our case, it was usually her. The first night, I phoned downstairs to asked her to call us a cab, and she called back and said “none are available.” When I asked her when one might be available, she almost barked “how should I know ?” Midday on our second to last day, the hotel fire alarm went off , causing my wife, who was resting, to have to get dressed and stand outside in the cold until it was determined to be a false alarm. Then the next morning at 9:15 AM, the alarm went off again. We were asleep, and had to throw on some clothes and rush downstairs. Isabelle was at the desk both times and told us it was once again a false alarm. Barely awake and exasperated, I told her this was unacceptable—two false alarms in less than a day. With no sympathy, she replied that it was very inconvenient for her as well. When we left at about 11 AM, the hotel’s single, small elevator wasn’t working. We took the stairs, and my wife told Isabelle “the elevator’s broken.” She argumentatively snapped “it’s not broken, it’s out of order.” My wife asked “what’s the difference ?” She said “if it’s broken it needs to be replaced, but it’s only out of order, and the repair company will have it fixed in 10 minutes.” OK, um…. When we returned that night, there was no one downstairs and the door was locked. It was freezing cold outside. I pressed the doorbell, it rang 15 times or so with no answer. A minute or two later (after about 3 minutes) Isabele showed up and opened the door. The elevator was still “out of order.” The hotel itself was fine if not exceptional—the rooms are very small, with very little storage (we had to stack our clothes on our suitcases) but everything is new, very clean, and the beds, linens are excellent. One of the employees, Sandra, was particularly nice and helpful. The 14 euro breakfast was skimpy, and for 9 euros you can eat much better at “Miss Manon”across the street. For $335+ a night, you can do much better than the Hotel Caron. This is a tiny hotel (18 rooms) with virtually no services, no bar, a single employee on staff most of the time, and a manager that has no business in the “service industry.” It’s new, and they may still be working out the bugs, but there’s no excuse for two false-alarm evacuations AND the only elevator out of service in a single 24 hour period. (and bye the way, the first of the “hotel photos” is of a park or town square nowhere near the hotel.)
